decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays with key cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. It uses cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge to deal damage quickly to opponents. The deck also includes control elements like Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands like Arid Mesa and Flooded Strand, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and power.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources and game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal, and graveyard hate. It also seeks to establish a powerful board presence quickly by playing aggressive creatures and utilizing flicker effects to gain extra value from entering the battlefield abilities. The deck aims to control the game tempo by hindering the opponent's plays while building up its own board state to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Crumbling Vestige, and Arboreal Grazer to cast powerful spells like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to search for lands and deal damage to the opponent. The key combo involves utilizing lands like Vesuva and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to generate additional value and win the game through overwhelming board presence and damage potential. By efficiently tutoring for key pieces using cards like Tolaria West and Summoner's Pact, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and take over the game.

The deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach in combination with various low-cost artifacts and cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch to create a powerful combo that can quickly assemble a win condition. The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard, recycling key cards, and generating a massive amount of mana to either mill the opponent out with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or deal lethal damage with Grapeshot. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga help to fuel the combo and ensure consistency in executing the game plan.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to put pressure on the opponent quickly. Key cards include Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer for early board presence, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury for late-game reach. The deck also utilizes Goblin Bombardment for extra damage and removal, as well as Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for added versatility. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of fast creature beats and direct burn damage.

This deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station to create a powerful combo that allows for continuous looping of spells and artifacts from the graveyard. The deck also includes various ways to generate mana through Mox Opal and Mox Amber, as well as card draw and selection with Mishra's Bauble and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent with a series of recursive plays and ultimately win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also utilizing key cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck aims to quickly close out games by efficiently dealing damage and outpacing the opponent's defenses. By combining efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge, the deck can apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main theme of this deck revolves around controlling the board through counterspells, removal, and planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler. The inclusion of Narset, Parter of Veils helps to limit the opponent's card advantage, while cards like Solitude and Supreme Verdict provide ways to deal with threats on the board. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck, with a mix of lands that provide different colors of mana. Overall, the focus is on outlasting the opponent through control and manipulation of the battlefield.

This deck focuses on utilizing a toolbox of creatures to assemble combos and generate value. It relies on cards like Birthing Ritual and Chord of Calling to tutor for key pieces such as Cauldron Familiar and Wall of Roots. By sacrificing and recurring creatures, the deck can generate tokens, gain life, and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Boseiju, Who Endures and Thoughtseize help protect the combo pieces, while Yawgmoth, Thran Physician serves as a powerful engine for card advantage and removal. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flexible and resilient creature-based strategy.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of creatures and spells from a variety of colors. By utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco, along with versatile spells like Leyline Binding and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Tribal Flames adds additional versatility and power to the deck, making it a formidable opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling combo pieces and disrupting the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards that can counter key spells, retrieve key pieces from the graveyard, and generate mana, the deck aims to unleash a powerful combo finisher in Goblin Charbelcher. With no reliance on lands, the deck can operate efficiently and smoothly, overwhelming the opponent with its streamlined strategy. It's all about carefully managing resources and timing to achieve victory in a burst of explosive combos.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones to apply pressure. The deck also incorporates flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to repeatedly trigger powerful enter-the-battlefield abilities on creatures. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of removal, card draw, and mana fixing to keep the pressure on the opponent and maintain board control.

The deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and played using Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith. It aims to generate value and create combo opportunities by sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Grist, the Hunger Tide. It also includes cards like Viscera Seer and Nurturing Peatland to help with sacrificing creatures. The deck utilizes various lands to fix mana and provide additional utility, while also including disruptive elements like Endurance and Sylvan Safekeeper to protect its combo and creatures.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a diverse mana base and efficient creatures. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent by utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tribal Flames for damage output. Leyline of Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help control the board while Scion of Draco provides a powerful finisher. Consign to Memory and Stubborn Denial offer versatility in dealing with threats, while Arena of Glory provides additional advantage. The deck's strategy is to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game to secure a swift victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage through cards like Teferi, Narset, and Tamiyo. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a board presence with powerful planeswalkers and removal spells. By consistently answering threats and drawing cards, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and eventually win the game through attrition. The mana base is optimized to support the control strategy and ensure consistency in casting spells.
